intro: Bonatea cirrhata, commonly known as the hairy bonatea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a hairy texture, which gives it its common name. Bonatea cirrhata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
